Could you two please discuss that issue privately after the meeting? We have several more items to cover and need to move on at this point.
I’m sorry, I really have to stop you there. We’ve run out of time.
Let’s save that conversation for another time.

I like swimming better than jogging.
I think that colour's much more attractive.
If it were up to me, I’d choose the green one.
If you ask me, the old one looks better than the new one.
I’m not an expert, but Design B seems more eye-catching.
(especially American English) It doesn’t really matter to me whether we eat here or go out.
(British English) I don’t really mind whether we talk now or later.
I’m happy either way.

reviews.text: I can express preferences in a variety of ways.

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.speech: There’s a Chinese restaurant next door, or an Italian just across the street.

dialog.speaker: B
dialog.speech: I think I’d prefer the Italian, myself. What about you?

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.speech: I don't really mind either way.

dialog.speaker: B
dialog.speech: OK, the Italian then!

sentences.sentence: There are two main reasons why I think it’s the best option: the cost and the quality.
I think it’s a good choice for a number of reasons, but primarily because it’s cheaper.
I believe it’s the right thing to do because it gives everyone a fair chance.
I would choose the newer one on the grounds that it will last longer.

reviews.text: I can give reasons and justify choices in a variety of ways.

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.speech: Why don’t you get a tablet?

dialog.speaker: B
dialog.speech: Well, first, I use the keyboard a lot, and second, you can't do as much with it.

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.speech: Hmm, maybe. But I like it just because it's so much easier to carry around.

dialog.speaker: B
dialog.speech: Well, it depends on your priorities, I guess.

sentences.sentence: What would you recommend?
What do you recommend?
What do you think would be best?
Which of the options do you favor?
Which of the options do you prefer?
I can recommend the steak today.
My favorite is the Corner Cafe.
I’d recommend waiting a few months.
I’d suggest you visit the museum first.
If it were up to me, I’d go for the cheaper one.
If it were up to me, I’d go to Paris.
If it were my decision, I’d choose the first one.
Why don’t you buy the blue one?

reviews.text: I can ask for a recommendation in a variety of ways.
I can make a recommendation in a variety of ways.

dialog.speaker: A

dialog.speaker: B
dialog.speech: What would you recommend?

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.speech: Well, if you haven't been there before, my favorite is San Francisco. It's great for a long weekend this time of year.

dialog.speaker: B
dialog.speech: San Fancisco. OK, yeah, I’ll look into that.

sentences.sentence: I think it’s likely that these people know each other.
I imagine she’s his wife.
(British English) They might be related.
That may be the case.
That could be his jacket.
I would think they’ve been waiting for some time.
I would imagine they’ve been waiting for some time.
I would guess that the car has broken down.
I guess she’ll phone you when she gets there.
I think this has probably happened before.
It looks to me as though the woman is very angry.
(British English) Perhaps there has been an accident.
Probably she forgot to leave a message.
Possibly he left his phone at home.
It may be that they aren’t coming.
Maybe she’s still at work.

reviews.text: I can speculate in a variety of ways.

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.speech: I’m going to an outdoor concert tonight. I wonder what'll happen if it rains.

dialog.speaker: B
dialog.speech: Hmm, they'll probably cancel it.

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.speech: But then how will everybody know?

dialog.speaker: B
dialog.speech: I don't know. I guess they'll put something on the website.

sentences.sentence: How about going out for a walk on Saturday?
(British English) Shall we ask Sarah to come along?
(especially American English) Should we ask Sarah to come along?
We could go a bit earlier and have a drink first, if you like.
We could try that new restaurant, if you want.
What do you think of the idea of sending this to the Research Department?
Why don't you try calling his landline?
Why not just wait until they come back?
Why not simply explain your problem to them and see what they say?

reviews.text: I can make suggestions in a variety of ways.

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.speech: How about meeting up around eight in front of the restaurant?

dialog.speaker: B
dialog.speech: Yeah, OK. Or we could meet a little earlier and have a drink first, if you want.

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.speech: Sure. Should we say seven o'clock in the lobby?

dialog.speaker: B
dialog.speech: Yeah, see you there.

sentences.sentence: I’m sorry you’re not well. I hope you feel better soon.
I’m sorry to hear that.
That’s bad luck.
How awful for you.
I’m sorry for your loss. (= used when somebody has died)

reviews.text: I can express sympathy in a variety of ways.

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.speech: I’m afraid I’m going to have to miss the conference. My father’s not doing well.

dialog.speaker: B
dialog.speech: Oh, I'm sorry to hear that.

dialog.speech: I hate to cancel at the last minute.

dialog.speech: No, I completely understand. Family comes first.

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.speech: Thanks.

sentences.sentence: I’m afraid time is running out, so we’ll have to make this the final question.
I’m afraid we’re running out of time, so we’ll have to stop here.
We’ve only got a couple of minutes left, so can we summarize what we’ve agreed?
I’d like to close the session with a few final remarks…
We’ll have to leave it there, but thank you all very much for your input.
Well, that’s all we have time for today, but we’ll meet again on Tuesday.
I’d like to thank you all for coming and for a very productive meeting.

reviews.text: I can wrap up discussions in a variety of ways.

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.speech: Well, I'm afraid time is running out, so unless anyone else has anything to add... Sorry, Jo, did you want to say something?

dialog.speaker: B
dialog.speech: Yes, can I just remind everybody to please send me your receipts for expenses? Thanks.

dialog.speaker: A
dialog.speech: OK, thanks Jo. Well, we’ll have to leave it there. Have a good trip home!
